intro: Boechera lincolnensis, commonly known as Lincoln's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small white or yellow flowers. Boechera lincolnensis typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to harsh, arid environments.
